ai.summary: Broch Walk is a short, easy 2.1 km loop in the UK that combines a gentle countryside stroll with a glimpse of a historic broch site. Suitable for families and beginners seeking a relaxed day out.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating paths composed of packed earth, gravel, and grass. Some sections run near historic stonework with uneven stones; expect occasional muddy patches after rain. Suitable footwear advised.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and avoid climbing on or around the broch ruins. Be cautious of uneven ground and slippery surfaces when wet. Weather in the UK can change quickly; bring appropriate clothing. Supervise children and keep dogs under control and on a leash where required. Carry a mobile phone for emergencies; in remote areas signal may be limited.
recommended_gear: Light rain jacket or layerable clothing
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (with mud precautions in winter)

seo.title: Broch Walk - Easy 2.1 km UK hike
seo.meta_description: Explore Broch Walk, a gentle 2.1 km route in the UK featuring a historic broch site, easy terrain, and family-friendly scenery.
seo.h1: Broch Walk: A gentle 2.1 km stroll through historic broch sites
